Dr. Harry Skornia
-2-
May 19, 1956
Your mention of clearing-house understandings caused
me to wonder if research information is being exchanged with
the networks and large agencies. I suppose these sources
have been explored, but in looking back through my file of
Fact Sheets I can find no reports of such origin. Perhaps
no great number of network or agency research studies would
meet the requirements, but some would definitely be of in¬
terest to educational broadcasters.
My last question is to ask why the Fact Sheet Service
must be self-supporting and on a subscription basis. One
result of the subscription system must be that many members
are slow in sending in the fee and some may feel it to be an
extra they can do without. I suspect the result is a spotty,
inconsistent kind of service to the membership. In my opinion,
all members should have the Fact Sheets.
Since the Fact Sheet Service is not an obviously ex¬
pensive operation, like the Tape Network, the reason for the
fee is subject to misunderstanding. One of the undesirable
wrong impressions is that this service is not really a basic
concern or responsibility of NAEB. It may seem to be an
extra service that MSB is undertaking as long as subscribers
will support it outside the regular MEB commitments. I
think the service is appropriate for the MSB to include as
one of its budget-supported functions. I would not like to
see this service taken over by any other organization.
At the present subscription rate, income from NAEB
members who might subscribe to the Fact Sheet Service would
not exceed $*J00. I think it would be worth more than $400
to furnish the service to every NAEB member. Non-members
should of course pay a fee. If the income from Service sub¬
scribers is a critical amount, then I would suggest that
the next raise in all classes of membership dues be suffi¬
cient to permit dropping the extra fee. I think the Fact
Sheets should come as a standard service to all members.
This would, incidentally, be a useful attraction to affiliate
members who may not now count many advantages of membership.
